snippet: Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh, an ideological group whose fortunes have ebbed and flowed with the influence of the Hindu right in New Delhi, has thrown its weight behind Narendra Modi.
abstract: Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh, ideological group whose fortunes have ebbed and flowed with influence of Hindu right in New Delhi, has thrown its weight behind Narendra Modi, who has been active in the group since childhood and is now the frontrunner for prime minister; group's leaders count Modi as one of their own and see in him a chance to move long-cherished goals to the top of the national agenda.
lead_paragraph: Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh, an ideological group whose fortunes have ebbed and flowed with the influence of the Hindu right in New Delhi, has thrown its weight behind Narendra Modi.

headline.main: In Indian Candidate, Hindu Right Sees a Reawakening
headline.print_headline: In Indian Candidate, Hindu Right Sees a Reawakening
